title: Rebecca Naomi Jones
text:
Rebecca Naomi Jones (born April 1981) is an American <a href="actress">actress</a> and <a href="singing">singer</a> best known for her performances in the <a href="Broadway%20theatre">Broadway</a> rock musicals "<a href="Passing%20Strange%20%28musical%29">Passing Strange</a>", "<a href="American%20Idiot%20%28musical%29">American Idiot</a>", and "<a href="Hedwig%20and%20the%20Angry%20Inch%20%28musical%29">Hedwig and the Angry Inch</a>" as well as being the first woman of color to play Laurey in "<a href="Oklahoma%20musical">Oklahoma!</a>" on Broadway.
Life and career.
Jones was born in <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a>, <a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York</a>, to a musician father and photographer mother. Her mother is Jewish and her father is African-American. Jones performed in the children's chorus of the <a href="Metropolitan%20Opera">Metropolitan Opera</a> as a child and graduated from the <a href="Berkeley%20Carroll%20School">Berkeley Carroll School</a> in 1999. "I did theatre all throughout middle school and high school and was really into it, the same with singing", she said. Jones received her <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Fine%20Arts">BFA</a> in drama from the <a href="University%20of%20North%20Carolina%20School%20of%20the%20Arts">University of North Carolina School of the Arts</a> and appeared in the national tours of "<a href="Rent%20%28musical%29">Rent</a>" and "<a href="Caroline%2C%20or%20Change">Caroline, or Change</a>".
In 2007 Jones made her <a href="Off-Broadway">Off-Broadway</a> debut in "<a href="Passing%20Strange%20%28musical%29">Passing Strange</a>", which transferred to Broadway on February 28, 2008. She originated the role of Whatsername in the <a href="Green%20Day">Green Day</a> rock opera "American Idiot", which opened on Broadway on April 20, 2010. "<a href="Paper%20%28magazine%29">Paper</a>" magazine said of Jones, "She's carved out a nice niche for herself as the girl to call when there's a cooler-than-thou musical in town."
In 2012 Jones played the Narrator in <a href="Manhattan%20Theatre%20Club">Manhattan Theatre Club</a>'s Off-Broadway musical "<a href="Murder%20Ballad%20%28musical%29">Murder Ballad</a>", for which she received a <a href="Lucille%20Lortel%20Award">Lucille Lortel Award</a> nomination for Outstanding Featured Actress. Jones returned for the show's engagement at the <a href="Union%20Square%20Theatre">Union Square Theatre</a>, which ran from May 22, 2013, to July 21, 2013. Later that summer, Jones appeared as Jaquenetta in a new musical adaptation of "<a href="Love%27s%20Labour%27s%20Lost">Love's Labour's Lost</a>" at <a href="Central%20Park">Central Park</a>'s <a href="Delacorte%20Theater">Delacorte Theater</a>.
On June 2, 2014, Jones received a Lilly Award, a prize honoring women in the theater.
On April 14, 2015, Jones replaced <a href="Lena%20Hall">Lena Hall</a> as Yitzhak in the Broadway production of "<a href="Hedwig%20and%20the%20Angry%20Inch%20%28musical%29">Hedwig and the Angry Inch</a>". Jones played the role through the production's end on September 13.
In 2017 she starred as Vanessa in <a href="Significant%20Other%20%28play%29">"Significant Other"</a> on Broadway.
In 2018 Jones starred as Laurey Williams in <a href="Daniel%20Fish">Daniel Fish</a>'s production of "<a href="Oklahoma%21">Oklahoma!</a>" at <a href="St.%20Ann%27s%20Warehouse">St. Ann's Warehouse</a>. The production transferred to Broadway at the <a href="Circle%20in%20the%20Square%20Theatre">Circle in the Square Theatre</a> in March 2019.
